capability.name: Term Deposit
capability.definition: A Term Deposit is an interest bearing account into which a customer can place a fixed amount of funds for a fixed amount of time. The Service Domain handles the opening, servicing and maturity processing of a Term Deposit.
capability.role: A Term Deposit is an interest bearing account into which a customer can place a fixed amount of funds for a fixed amount of time. The Service Domain handles the opening, servicing and maturity processing of a Term Deposit. Early closing of a Term Deposit may be allowed by the bank, but in that case penalty interest rates and charges may be applied. NB In BIAN demand deposits are seen as Savings Accounts.
capability.example: A customer has excess funds available. They select a standard Term Deposit product from the bank or, in the case of a larger amount, may negotiate specific conditions for a Term Deposit and instruct the bank to transfer an amount into the new Term Deposit account.
